title: Stabilize production build and improve intro-to-quiz UX

requirements.summary: Resolve production publish/build failure by ensuring all required static assets are present and referenced safely in production.
acceptanceCriteria: A production publish attempt completes successfully without a deployment error.
The deployed production URL loads and renders the quiz app without a blank screen or runtime errors.
If the deployment issue was caused by missing/static assets (e.g., /assets/generated/*, /assets/buzz.mp3), ensure the build includes them and they are served correctly in production.

file_operations.description: Add the missing wrong-answer audio asset so production can serve /assets/buzz.mp3 reliably.
Ensure the generated image asset exists in the production-served public directory at frontend/public/assets/generated/heart-icon.dim_256x256.png.
Ensure the generated image asset exists in the production-served public directory at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-bg.dim_1920x1080.png.
Ensure the generated image asset exists in the production-served public directory at frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-header.dim_1600x400.png.
Harden wrong-answer audio initialization/playback to avoid runtime errors if audio fails to load in production (e.g., handle missing asset or autoplay restrictions gracefully).
Verify background image references remain aligned with public asset paths and adjust any asset URL usage that could break in production.

requirements.summary: Add a smooth fade-style transition from the Intro screen to Level 1 when starting the quiz.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Start the Quiz” triggers a smooth transition from IntroSlide to Level1 (no abrupt cut).
The transition works on mobile and desktop and does not block user interaction longer than the intended animation duration.
The transition does not regress existing intro animations or level rendering.

file_operations.description: Create a small transition wrapper component that can fade out the current slide and fade in the next slide without changing quiz logic.
Wire the new SlideTransition wrapper into the IntroSlide -> Level1 flow so clicking Start triggers a fade transition before rendering Level 1.
Add/adjust Tailwind keyframes/animations (fade in/out) needed for the intro-to-level transition while keeping existing animations intact.

requirements.summary: Prevent quiz question titles and prompts from being clipped/truncated on small mobile screens by fixing layout and overflow behaviors.
acceptanceCriteria: On small mobile viewport sizes, every level’s question/title text wraps to multiple lines and is fully readable (no clipping).
No container uses overflow settings that cut off question text vertically.
The fix is verified in the built production bundle (not only in dev).

file_operations.description: Replace overly restrictive page-level overflow rules (e.g., avoid full-page overflow-hidden that can clip tall content) while preserving the intended background/visual layout.
Ensure slide title styling robustly wraps on small screens (no vertical clipping), including any needed padding/line-height adjustments.
Adjust answer option button text wrapping (e.g., allow multi-line labels) so long options remain fully visible on small screens.
Adjust answer option button text wrapping (e.g., allow multi-line labels) so long options remain fully visible on small screens.
Adjust answer option button text wrapping (e.g., allow multi-line labels) and confirm the long question title remains readable without clipping.
Adjust answer option button text wrapping (e.g., allow multi-line labels) so long options remain fully visible on small screens.
Confirm the prompt/label and textarea layout remain readable on small screens and do not introduce overflow-based clipping.
